title: Science & Innovation
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing scientific research, technological innovation, and breakthroughs.

words.meaning: an important discovery or achievement
words.example: The breakthrough in cancer research offers new hope for patients.

words.meaning: a proposed explanation based on limited evidence
words.example: The scientist tested her hypothesis through repeated experiments.

words.meaning: the introduction of new ideas or methods
words.example: Technological innovation has transformed modern communication.

words.meaning: a scientific test to discover something
words.example: The experiment was conducted under controlled conditions.

words.meaning: facts and statistics collected for analysis
words.example: The data was analyzed by a team of researchers.

words.meaning: systematic investigation to establish facts
words.example: Medical research is being funded by the government.

words.meaning: a room equipped for scientific work
words.example: The vaccine was developed in a secure laboratory.

words.meaning: exclusive rights granted for an invention
words.example: The company was granted a patent for its new technology.

words.meaning: made by humans rather than occurring naturally
words.example: Artificial intelligence is being integrated into many industries.

words.meaning: able to be maintained without depleting resources
words.example: Sustainable energy sources are being developed worldwide.

words.meaning: relating to genes or heredity
words.example: Genetic testing can identify inherited diseases.

words.meaning: capable of being replaced naturally
words.example: Solar and wind are renewable energy sources.

words.meaning: based on theory rather than practice
words.example: The concept remains theoretical until proven experimentally.

words.meaning: based on observation or experience
words.example: Empirical evidence supports the new theory.

words.meaning: an early model of a product
words.example: The prototype was tested before mass production.

words.meaning: to examine something in detail
words.example: Scientists analyzed the samples in the laboratory.

words.meaning: to create or improve something over time
words.example: The team developed a new treatment method.

words.meaning: to find something for the first time
words.example: The element was discovered by accident.

words.meaning: to put a plan into action
words.example: The new system will be implemented next year.

words.meaning: to make partial changes to something
words.example: The design was modified based on user feedback.

words.meaning: to imitate conditions for testing purposes
words.example: The computer simulated various climate scenarios.

words.meaning: to confirm or verify something
words.example: The results were validated by independent researchers.

words.meaning: evaluation of work by experts in the field
words.example: The paper underwent rigorous peer review before publication.

words.meaning: a research study testing medical treatments
words.example: The drug is currently in clinical trials.

words.meaning: the system of methods used in research
words.example: The study's methodology was questioned by critics.

words.meaning: relating to the smallest units of energy
words.example: Quantum computing is expected to revolutionize technology.

words.meaning: technology at the molecular or atomic scale
words.example: Nanotechnology is being used to develop new materials.

words.meaning: relating to biology and medicine
words.example: Biomedical research has led to many new treatments.

words.meaning: a set of rules for solving problems
words.example: The algorithm was designed to detect patterns in data.

words.meaning: to reproduce or copy exactly
words.example: Other scientists were unable to replicate the results.

exercises.instruction: Match the words with their definitions

pairs.definition: a proposed explanation based on limited evidence
an early model of a product
evaluation of work by experts in the field

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the correct words

sentences.sentence: The _____ was tested in laboratory conditions before release.
Scientists were unable to _____ the experiment's results.

exercises.instruction: Choose the best word to complete each sentence

questions.question: The scientist made a major _____ that could change medicine.
The drug must complete _____ before it can be approved.
